etymology.description: semantic: 米 ‘rice’ + phonetic: 青 — ‘polished rice’.
etymology.interpretation: Rice provides the meaning domain of grain/food, while 青 supplies the sound and evokes clarity or brightness. The sense ‘polished rice’ naturally extended to ideas of refinement and purity, then figuratively to ‘essence’ and ‘spirit’ in compounds.

examples.chinese: 这道菜的精华在汤里(這道菜的精華在湯裡)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè dào cài de jīnghuá zài tāng lǐ.
examples.english: The essence of this dish is in the soup.

examples.chinese: 这种油很精纯(這種油很精純)。
examples.english: This type of oil is very pure.

examples.chinese: 休息以后(休息以後)，他精神好多了(他精神好多了)。
examples.pinyin: Xiūxí yǐhòu, tā jīngshén hǎo duō le.
examples.english: After resting, his spirit improved a lot.
